He knew he had become monosyllabic with his family and less responsive to everyone in general. He felt his life was incomplete. He sought some advice on complementary therapies from his friends, and received
some impressive feedback from them on therapies such as hypnotherapy and aromatherapy. The treatments certainly didnâ€™t appear too pricey, and after a couple of sessions of both therapies, he felt more cheerful and humorous about life in general. Trivial things that formerly caused him to worry became
unimportant, and he even looked forward to the often dull biannual work conference! He now has a more harmonious family life, and has just redecorated a room in his house lovely atmospheric colours where the whole family can go to relax and recuperate.
